title: Independence Day 2022: Summary of Indian National Movement
article_content: Independence Day 2022:The Indian National Movement was an organised mass movement concerned with the interests of the people of India and affected by both internal and external factors. It led to the formation of the Indian National Congress in 1885. Read in detail below. By Shikha Goyal Aug 12, 2022, 13:41 IST Indian National Movement Independence Day 2022: India celebrates Independence Day every year on August 15. In 2022, this day will be historically significant as the country completes 75 years of Independence from the imperial rule of the Britishers. In these 75 years, India's journey has been nothing less than adventurous, both politically and socially. India's Independence from the imperial power was full of sacrifices. The struggle to gain independence has a long list of movements that were required to show a united front to make the voices reach to every corner of the world. As India celebrates the 75 years of its glorious Independence, we remember here the Indian National Movement and various significant phases attached to it. Summary of Indian National Movement It has been observed that the struggles for Freedom in India had been a merger of a series of Political, Socio-Cultural, and Economic factors that led to the rise of Nationalism. On 28 December 1885 Indian National Congress (INC) was founded on the premises of Gokuldas Tejpal Sanskrit School at Bombay. It was presided over by W.C Banerjee and attended by 72 delegates. A.O Hume played an instrumental role in the foundation of INC with an aim to provide Safety Valve to the British Government. A.O Hume served as the first General Secretary of INC. The real Aim of Congress is to train the Indian youth in political agitation and to organise or to create public opinion in the country. For this, they use the method of an annual session where they discuss the problem and passed the resolution. The first or early phase of Indian Nationalism is also termed as Moderate Phase (1885-1905). Moderate leaders were W.C Banerjee, Gopal Krishna Gokhale, R.C Dutt, Ferozeshah Mehta, George Yule, etc. Moderates have full faith in British Government and adopted the PPP path i.e. Protest, Prayer, and Petition. Due to disillusionment from Moderates' methods of work, extremism began to develop within the congress after 1892. The Extremist leaders were Lala Lajpat Rai, Bal Gangadhar Tilak, Bipin Chandra Pal, and Aurobindo Ghosh. Instead of the PPP path, they emphasise on self-reliance, constructive work, and swadeshi. With the announcement of the Partition of Bengal (1905) by Lord Curzon for administrative convenience, Swadeshi and Boycott resolution was passed in 1905. Happy Independence Day 2021: Wishes, WhatsApp Messages, Quotes, Slogan, Images & SMS Congress Sessions during Swadeshi Movement : 1. 1905 – Congress session in Banaras. Presided over by Gopal Krishan Gokhale. 2. 1906 – Congress Session in Calcutta. Presided over by Dadabhai Naroji. 3. 1907 – Congress Session in Surat on the bank of the river Tapti. Presided over by Pherozeshah Mehta where due to the differences between Moderates and Extremists first split in Congress occurred . Muslim League was founded in 1906 by Agah Khan III and Moshin Mulk. Separate electorate was introduced by the Act of 1909 Morley- Minto Reform Act . Gadhar Movement was started by Lala Hardayal in 1913 and founded the Gadhar party on 1 st November 1913. Its headquarter was set up in the form of Yugantar Ashram in San Francisco and started the publication of Gadhar Journal. Komgata Maru incident took place in September 1914 and for this Indians set up a committee named as Shore Committee to fight the legal battle of the passengers. In 1914 First World War broke out. Tilak on April 1916 started Home Rule Movement and its headquarter was at Poona and demanded Swaraj. Annie Besant on September 1916 started the Home Rule movement and its headquarter was at Adiyar near Madras. Lucknow Session of Congress 1916 was presided over by Ambika Charan Majumdar (Moderate leader) where both Extremist and Moderate leaders were united. Government of India Act 1919 or Montagu- Chelmsford Reform Act was passed to establish a responsible Government in India. On 9 th January 1915, Gandhi ji returns to India from South Africa at the age of 46. In 1916 Gandhi Ji founded Sabarmati Ashram at Ahmadabad (Gujarat) to preach the idea of truth and non-violence. Champaran Satyagraha – 1917 Kheda Satyagraha – 1917 Ahmadabad Mill Strike – 1918 Rowlatt Act Satyagraha February,1919 Gandhi ji founded the Satyagraha Sabha in February, 1919. In this movement students, middle class, labour, and capitalist participated, and congress as an organisation was nowhere. This was the first mass movement of Gandhi ji. Jallianwala Bagh Massacre – 13 April, 1919. People were gathered at Jallianwala Bagh in Amritsar to protest against the arrest of Saifuddin Kitchlew and Satyapal on 13 April 1919. On 1 st August 1920 Khilafat Committee launched a Non-Cooperation movement on triple issues- Punjab wrongs, Khilafat issue, and Demand for Swaraj. Therefore , Non-Cooperation Movement was started in 1920. In October 1920 All India Trade Union Congress was founded in Bombay by N. M Joshi, Ray Chaudhary. Presided over by Lala Lajpat Ray Akali Movement was started in 1920. In 1925, SGPC (Shiromani Gurudwara Prabhandak Committee) was founded. Congress Khilafat Swaraj Party was formed by CR Das and Motilal Nehru. Also famous for the second split in the congress. In 1927, the Workers & Peasant Party (WPP) was formed at Bombay by S.S Mirajkar, K. N Juglekar, and S.V Ghate. In 1924, H.R.A (Hindustan Republican Association) was formed at Kanpur. Its members were CS Azad, Sachin Sanyal, and Ramprasad Bismil. In 1929, HSRA (Hindustan Socialist Republic Association) was formed at Firozeshah Kotla Delhi. Bhagat Singh joined HSRA. On 9 August, 1925 Kakori Train Dacoit, in this conspiracy case Ram Prasad Bismil, Rajendra Lahiri, Roshan Lal, and Asafaqullah khan were hanged to death. On 23 rd March, 1931 Bhagat Singh, Rajguru, and Sukhdev were hanged to death in Lahore Conspiracy Case. On 8 November, 1927 Simon Commission was appointed by the British Conservative government under Stanley Baldwin. To inquire in the working system of Government in the country after the reform act of 1919. Nehru Report - 1928 for dominion status, universal adult franchise, etc. Jinnah’s 14 point programme was on 31 st March, 1929. 1929 Lahore Session of INC presided by Jawaharlal Nehru where the resolution of Purna Swaraj was passed by congress and decided to launch a Civil Disobedience movement under the leadership of Gandhi ji. On 26 th January, 1930 Independence Day was celebrated for the 1 st time. Civil Disobedience Movement was started with the Dandi March . From 12 March to 6 April , 1930 Gandhi ji along with his 78 followers marched from Sabarmati Ashram to Dandi and broke the salt law by making salt on 6 th April 1930. On 12 November 1930, First Round Table Conference was held. On 5 th March 1931, Gandhi Irwin Pact was signed. On 23 rd March 1931, the Trial of Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev . On 29 March 1931, Karachi Session of INC , presided over by Vallabh Bhai Patel. In this session first time, a resolution of Fundamental Rights and Economic policy was passed. On 7 th September 1931, Second Round Table Conference was held in which Gandhi ji participated on the behalf of congress. On 16 th August 1932, Communal or Ramsay Macdonald Award was announced. On 26 th September 1932 , Poona pact was signed. In November 1932, the Third Round Table Conference was held. In 1935, the Government of India Act was passed to create the All India Federation, Provincial Autonomy and Diarchy should be there in the centre. Towards Quit India Movement Important Congress Sessions : √ 1936 – Lucknow (UP) – Presided by J.L Nehru √ 1937 – Faizpur (Maharashtra) – Presided by J.L Nehru ( First session held in the village) √ 1938 – Haripura (Gujarat) – Presided by S.C Bose √ 1939 – Tripuri (M.P) – Presided by S.C Bose In September, 1939 IInd World War b roke out and India was declared an ally without its consent. In 1939 S.C Bose founded Forward Bloc . It was a left party. On 10 th August, 1940 – August Offer was announced by Lord Linlithgow viceroy to get the support of Indians in the Second World War. On 11 th March, 1942 Prime Minister Winstill Churchill announced sending a mission under the chairmanship of Sir Stafford Cripps to find out the solution of constitutional deadlock and problems of Indians. With the failure of Cripps Mission, Quit India movement was started in 1942 by the Indian leaders and the resolution of Quit India was drafted by Gandhi Ji. Gandhi ji gave a call for Do or Die. In 1942 - Indian National Army was founded by Captain Mohan Singh and Niranjan Gill in Singapore. S. C Bose took over its command of 2 nd headquarters in Singapore and Rangoon. On 21 st October, 1943 – Azad Hind Government was set up in Singapore under S.C Bose. There was a women regiment known as Rani Jhansi. In 1945, the Second World War was ended. In 1 945 – Shimla Conference or Wavell Plan was proposed by Lord Wavell to solve the political deadlock. In 1946, Cabinet Mission Plan was announced by PM Clement Attlee. On 2 nd September 1946 - Interim Government was set up under J.L Nehru. In March 1947 – Lord Mountbatten was sent to India with an aim to find a way to transfer power. Also known as Plan Balkan. On 3 rd June Independence of India Act, 1947 was passed by which powers were transferred to two Dominion States India and Pakistan. title: Indian States and Capitals 2023: Check List of Indian States, UT, and their Capitals
article_content: India is a union of 28 States & 8 Union Territories. Through this article, we take a look at the Indian States and Union Territories, along with their Capitals and Chief Ministers/ Lieutenant Governors/ Administrators. By Mayank Uttam Jun 13, 2023, 13:31 IST Indian States and their Capitals Indian States, UT, and Capitals: India is a vast country with a rich history and culture. It is also a federal republic, which means that it is divided into states and union territories. Each state and union territory has its own capital city. The capital cities of India are home to the governments of their respective states and union territories. India is a union of 28 States & 8 Union Territories. The states and union territories are further subdivided into districts and smaller administrative divisions. The Constitution was adopted on 26 November 1949 and came into force on 26 January 1950. The boundaries of Indian states are reorganised on a linguistic basis by the States Reorganisation Act, 1956. Through this article, we take a look at the Indian States and Union Territories, along with their Capitals and Chief Ministers/ Lieutenant Governors/ Administrators. Also Read | Union Territories of India List of the Indian States and Capitals Below is the complete list of the Indian States and their Capitals, along with their Chief Ministers. Andhra Pradesh Capital: Amaravati Chief Minister: Shri YS Jagan Mohan Reddy Arunachal Pradesh Capital: Itanagar Chief Minister: Shri Pema Khandu Assam Capital: Dispur Chief Minister: Shri Himanta Biswa Sarma Bihar Capital: Patna Chief Minister: Shri Nitish Kumar Chhattisgarh Capital: Raipur Chief Minister: Shri Bhupesh Baghel Goa Capital: Panaji Chief Minister: Shri Pramod Sawant Gujarat Capital: Gandhinagar Chief Minister: Shri Bhupendra Patel Haryana Capital: Chandigarh Chief Minister: Shri Manohar Lal Khattar Himachal Pradesh Capital: Shimla (summer), Dharamshala (winter) Chief Minister: Shri Jairam Thakur Jharkhand Capital: Ranchi Chief Minister: Shri Hemant Soren Karnataka Capital: Bengaluru Chief Minister: Sri Siddaramaiah Kerala Capital: Thiruvananthapuram Chief Minister: Shri Pinarayi Vijayan Madhya Pradesh Capital: Bhopal Chief Minister: Shri Shivraj Singh Chouhan Maharashtra Capital: Mumbai (summer), Nagpur (winter) Chief Minister: Shri Uddhav Thackeray Manipur Capital: Imphal Chief Minister: Shri N. Biren Singh Meghalaya Capital: Shillong Chief Minister: Shri Conrad Kongkal Sangma Mizoram Capital: Aizawl Chief Minister: Shri Pu Zoramthanga Nagaland Capital: Kohima Chief Minister: Shri Neiphiu Rio Odisha Capital: Bhubaneswar Chief Minister: Shri Naveen Patnaik Punjab Capital: Chandigarh Chief Minister: Shri Charanjit Singh Channi Rajasthan Capital: Jaipur Chief Minister: Shri Ashok Gehlot Sikkim Capital: Gangtok Chief Minister: Shri PS Golay Tamil Nadu Capital: Chennai Chief Minister: Shri M. K. Andaman & Nicobar Islands Capital : Port Blair Lieutenant Governor: Shri Devendra Kumar Joshi Chandigarh Capital : Chandigarh Administrator: Shri Banwarilal Purohit Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu Capital : Daman Administrator: Shri Praful Patel Lakshadweep Capital : Kavaratti Administrator: Shri Praful Patel Puducherry Capital : Puducherry Chief Minister: Shri N. Rangaswamy Lieutenant Governor : Dr. Tamilisai Soundararajan National Capital Territory of Delhi Capital : Delhi Chief Minister: Shri Arvind Kejriwal Lieutenant Governor: Shri Anil Baijal Jammu and Kashmir Capital: Srinagar (summer), Jammu (winter) Lieutenant Governor: Shri Manoj Sinha Ladakh Capital: Leh (summer), Kargil (winter) Lieutenant Governor: Shri Radha Krishna Mathur Also Read | GK Quiz on States and Union Territories of India List of Indian States and UTs and their Capitals State Capital Chief Minister Andhra Pradesh Amaravati YS Jagan Mohan Reddy Arunachal Pradesh Itanagar Pema Khandu Assam Dispur Himanta Biswa Sarma Bihar Patna Nitish Kumar Chhattisgarh Raipur Bhupesh Baghel Goa Panaji Pramod Sawant Gujarat Gandhinagar Bhupendra Patel Haryana Chandigarh Manohar Lal Khattar Himachal Pradesh Shimla (summer) Dharamshala (winter) Jairam Thakur Jharkhand Ranchi Hemant Soren Karnataka Bengaluru Basavaraj Bommai Kerala Thiruvananthapuram Pinarayi Vijayan Madhya Pradesh Bhopal Shivraj Singh Chouhan Maharashtra Mumbai (summer) Nagpur (winter) Uddhav Thackeray Manipur Imphal N. Biren Singh Meghalaya Shillong Conrad Kongkal Sangma Mizoram Aizawl Pu Zoramthanga Nagaland Kohima Neiphiu Rio Odisha Bhubaneswar Naveen Patnaik Punjab Chandigarh Charanjit Singh Channi Rajasthan Jaipur Ashok Gehlot Sikkim Gangtok PS Golay Tamil Nadu Chennai M. K. Stalin Telangana Hyderabad K Chandrasekhar Rao Tripura Agartala Biplab Kumar Deb Uttar Pradesh Lucknow Yogi Adityanath Uttarakhand Bhararisain (summer) Dehradun (winter) Pushkar Singh Dhami West Bengal Kolkata Mamata Banerjee Union Territory Capital Chief Minister/ Lieutenant Governor/ Administrator Andaman & Nicobar Islands Port Blair Devendra Kumar Joshi (LG) Chandigarh Chandigarh Banwarilal Purohit (Administrator) Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu Daman Praful Patel (Administrator) Lakshadweep Kavaratti Praful Patel (Administrator) Puducherry Puducherry N. Rangaswamy (CM) Dr. Tamilisai Soundararajan (LG) National Capital Territory of Delhi Delhi Arvind Kejriwal (CM) Anil Baijal (LG) Jammu and Kashmir Srinagar (summer) Jammu (winter) Manoj Sinha (LG) Ladakh Leh (summer) Kargil (winter) Radha Krishna Mathur (LG) The Indian Constitution is federal in nature but unitary in a method which means States in India do not have the right to secede from the union. Hence, India has both unitary features (like appointing governor, concurrent list, single citizenship, single constitution) and federal features (Union List, State List, State Election, etc.). So, it is quasi-federal. title: List of Important Days and Dates 2024: National, International Days
article_content: Important Days and Dates 2024: Check out the list of national and international days, significant days and dates, important days and dates for competitive exams. Know the list of holidays, birth anniversaries, death anniversaries, national days, international days, important days and dates PDF, month wise important days and more. By Shikha Goyal Jan 1, 2024, 16:29 IST Important Days and dates 2024 Important Days and Dates 2024: Every month has important days and dates that are important from a national and international point of view. These days are commemorated based on a significant event that took place on that particular day. People should be aware of all the important days and dates in 2024 to be aware of the events that took place. In today’s world having a good knowledge of month-wise important dates has become highly important as government job aspirants are often asked 2 to 3 questions based on it. It will not only provide you with a glance at important days of 2024 but also boost your knowledge and help you in the preparation of competitive exams such as IAS, State PCS, SSC CGL, SSC CHSL, Banking Exams , RRB, etc. Going through the calendar 2024 with important days and dates will help you not only to fetch marks but also be conscience of the events that have taken place. Important Days & Dates 2024 A number of important days and dates are lined up in 2024. A candidate aspiring to crack government exams such as UPSC, State PCS, SSC, RRB, Banking exams, etc. should check out the list of important days and dates 2024 for each month. Going through these days every day will help in easily recalling of all the important days and dates month-wise. The important days and dates are asked in the General Awareness section of any competitive exam. Important National and International Days 2024 A number of events occur on each day. The important days in 2024 are not only restricted nationally but internationally as well. Several important days are celebrated with fervour and joy all over the world. These days include International Day for Peace, International Women’s Day, World Anti-Tobacco Day, World Environment Day, International Yoga Day, etc. Celebrating these important days have a theme attached to it that helps in recognizing and spreading awareness for each day worldwide. In the following article, you can find the important days and dates list. Month-wise Important Dates There are 12 months in a year beginning from January and ending with December. Every month consists of many national and international days that are of importance to the world. Candidates who are preparing to crack competitive exams should have a good knowledge of important days and dates that fall in each month. Go through the list of important days for each month below. Important Days & Dates of January 2024 January marks the beginning of the new year calendar. It is the first month of the Gregorian and Julian calendars. Important days such as International World Braille Day, Pravasi Bhartiya Diwas, World Hindi Day, Republic Day and other important days are observed in January. Let us look at all the important days and dates January in the table below. List of Important Days January 2024 1st January English New Year Global Family Day 4th January World Braille Day 5th January National Birds Day 6th January World War Orphans Day 8th January African National Congress Foundation Day 9th January Pravasi Bharatiya Divas (NRI Day) 10th January World Hindi Day 11th January Death anniversary of Lal Bahadur Shastri 12th January National Youth Day (Birth Day of Swami Vivekanand) 13th January Lohri 15th January Army Day Makar Sankranti Pongal 20th January Penguin Awareness Day 23rd January Netaji Subhash Chandra bose Birthday 24th January National Girl Child Day 25th January India Tourism Day National Voters Day 26th January Republic Day of India International Customs Day 27th January International Holocaust Day (The largest Nazi death camp, Auschwitz- Birkenau was liberated by Soviet troops on Jan 27, 1945) 28th January Birth Anniversary of Lala Lajpat Rai 28th January Data protection day KM Carriappa Day 30th January Martyr’s Day (Mahatma Gandhi’s Martyrdom Day) World Leprosy Eradication Day 31st January International Zebra Day Important Days & Dates of February 2024 The second month of the year is February. February has the shortest days in a year. It has 29 days in case of a leap year and 28 days when it is not a leap year. February marks a number of important days such as World Wetlands Day, World Cancer Day, World Wetlands Day, International Mother Language Day, Valentine's Day, Arunachal Pradesh Foundation Day, National Science Day, etc. Given below are the important days of February . List of Important Days February 2024 Date in February Events 1 February Indian Coast Guard Day 2 February World Wetlands Day 4 February World Cancer Day 5 February to 13 February Kala Ghoda Festival 6 February International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation 6 February to 12 February International Development Week 8 February Safer Internet Day 10 February National Deworming Day 10 February World Pulses Day 11 February World Day of the Sick 11 February International Day of Women and Girls in Science 12 February Darwin Day 12 February Abraham Lincoln's Birthday 12 February National Productivity Day 13 February World Radio Day 13 February Sarojini Naidu Birth Anniversary 14 February Saint Valentine's Day 14 February Vasant Panchami 18 February to 27 February Taj Mahotsav 20 February Arunachal Pradesh Foundation Day World Day of Social Justice 21 February International Mother Language Day 22 February World Thinking Day 24 February Central Excise Day 27 February World NGO Day 28 February National Science Day Rare Disease Day Important Days & Dates of March 2024 March is the 3rd month of the year. March has a number of world recognized days and dates. Some of the significant days and dates in March 2024 are International Womens Day, Pi Day, World TB Day, World Sparrow Day, No Smoking Day, etc. These days help in spreading awareness and making people more responsible towards a cause. Let us look at the important days of March 2024 . List of Important Days March 2024 Date Important Days 1 March Zero Discrimination Day World Civil Defence Day Self Injury Awareness Day 3 March World Wildlife Day World Hearing Day 4 March National Safety Day Employee Appreciation Day 4 March Ramakrishna Jayanti 8 March International Women's Day 9 March No Smoking Day (Second Wednesday of March) 10 March CISF Raising Day 12 March Mauritius Day 14 March Pi Day 14 March International Day of Action for Rivers 15 March World Consumer Rights Day 16 March National Vaccination Day 18 March Ordnance Factories Day (India) 20 March International Day of Happiness 20 March World Sparrow Day 20 March Hindi New Year 21 March World Forestry Day 21 March World Down Syndrome Day 21 March World Poetry Day 22 March World Water Day 23 March World Meteorological Day 24 March World Tuberculosis (TB) Day 24 March Holika Dahan 25 March International Day of the Unborn Child 25 March Holi 25 March International Day of Solidarity with Detained and Missing Staff Members 26 March Purple Day of Epilepsy 27 March World Theatre Day 29 March Good Friday Important Days & Dates of April 2024 April according to the Gregorian calendar, it is the fourth month of the year. In Southern Hemisphere, March month is associated with the autumn season in some parts and spring in some parts of the Northern Hemisphere. April is named after the Greek goddess Aphrodite. Days such as Odisha Foundation Day, World Health Day, World Haemophilia Day, Ayushman Bharat Diwas, Cultural Unity Day, etc are observed in this month. Let us look at the important days in April below. List of Important Days April 2024 Date Name of Important Days 1 April Odisha Foundation Day 1 April Aprils Fools' Day 1 April Prevention of Blindness week 2 April World Autism Awareness Day 4 April International Day of Mine Awareness 5 April National Maritime Day 7 April World Health Day 9 April Ugadi / Gudi Padwa / Telugu New Year 10 April World Homoeopathy Day (WHD) 11 April National Safe Motherhood Day (NSMD) 11 April National Pet Day 13 April Vaisakhi / Baisakhi / Vishu 13 April Jallianwala Bagh Massacre 14 April B.R. Ambedkar Remembrance Day 14 April Tamil New Year 15 April Bengali New Year / Bihu 17 April Rama Navami 17 April World Haemophilia Day 18 April World Heritage Day 21 April National Civil Service Day 22 April World Earth Day 23 April Hanuman Jayanti 23 April World Book and Copyright Day 24 April National Panchayati Raj Day 25 April World Malaria Day 26 April World Intellectual Property Day 28 April World Day for Safety and Health at Work 30 April World Veterinary Day Important Days & Dates of May 2024 May marks the fifth month of the year. Many important days are observed in this month that have cultural and religious and public importance associated with them. The 1st day of May itself begins with International Labour Day. Other than this, other important days and dates in May include Buddha Purnima, World Asthma Day, World No-Tobacco Day, Mothers’ Day and more. Let us look at the other important days and dates of May in the table below: List of Important Days May 2024 Date Important Days 1 May International Labour Day or May Day Maharashtra Day Gujarat Day World Laughter Day (first Sunday of May) 3 May Press Freedom Day 3 May World Asthma Day (First Tuesday of May) 4 May Coal Miners Day International Firefighter’s Day 7 May World Athletics Day 8 May World Red Cross Day 8 May World Thalassaemia Day 8 May Mother's Day (Second Sunday of May) 9 May Rabindranath Tagore Jayanti 11 May National Technology Day 12 May International Nurses Day 15 May International Day of Families 17 May World Telecommunication Day 17 May World Hypertension Day 18 May World AIDS Vaccine Day 18 May International Museum Day 20 May National Endangered Species Day (Third Friday in May) 21 May National Anti-Terrorism Day 21 May Armed Forces Day (Third Saturday of the May) 22 May International Day for Biological Diversity 31 May National Memorial Day (last Monday of May) 31 May Anti-Tobacco Day Important Days & Dates of June 2024 June marks the 6th month of the year having 30 days. June is named after the goddess of youth, “Juno”. This month has a number of important days that include World Environment Day, International Yoga Day, Fathers’ Day, International Olympic Day, United Nations Public Service Day and many more days that have been given below. Here are the important days and dates of June . List of Important Days June 2024 Date Important Days 1 June World Milk Day 1 June Global Day of Parents 2 June International Sex Workers' Day 2 June Telangana Formation Day 3 June World Bicycle Day 4 June International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression 5 June World Environment Day 7 June World Food Safety Day 8 June World Brain Tumour Day 8 June World Oceans Day 12 June World Day Against Child Labour 14 June World Blood Donor Day 15 June World Wind Day 15 June World Elder Abuse Awareness Day 16 June Martyrdom of Guru Arjan Dev 17 June World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought (International) 18 June Autistic Pride Day 18 June International Picnic Day 19 June World Sickle Cell Awareness Day 19 June World Sauntering Day 20 June World Refugee Day (International) 3rd Sunday of June World Father’s Day 21 June World Music Day 21 June World Hydrography Day 21 June International Yoga Day 23 June International Olympic Day 23 June United Nations Public Service Day 23 June International Widow's Day 26 June International Day against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking 26 June International Day in Support of Victims of Torture 29 June National Statistics Day 29 June International Day of the Tropics 30 June World Asteroid Day Important Days & Dates of July 2024 July begins with several important days falling on the first day itself. Days such as National Doctor’s Day, Canada Day, CA Day (in India), etc. July is named after the Roman dictator Gaius Julius Caesar. The hot and humid days that are a part of July month are known as “the dog days.” The important days and dates of July have been mentioned in the table below. List of Important Days July 2024 Date Name of Important Days 1 July National Doctor’s Day National Postal Worker Day Canada Day Chartered Accountants Day (India) National U.S. Postage Stamp Day National Gingersnap Day 2 July World UFO Day 2 July National Anisette Day 3 July National Fried Clam Day 4 July Independence Day USA 6 July World Zoonoses Day 7 July World Chocolate Day 7 July Jagannath Puri Rath Yatra 9 July National Sugar Cookie Day 11 July World Population Day National 7-Eleven Day 12 July National Simplicity Day Paper Bag Day Malala Day 14 July Bastille Day or French National Day 15 July World Youth Skills Day 15 July Social Media Giving Day 17 July World Day for International Justice 17 July World Emoji Day 18 July International Nelson Mandela Day 20 July International Chess Day 20 July Moon Day 21 July Guru Purnima 22 July Pi Approximation Day 22 July National Mango Day or Mango Day 22 July Chandrayaan 2 launching date 24 July National Thermal Engineer Day 24 July National Parent's Day (Fourth Sunday in July) 25 July National Refreshment Day (Fourth Thursday in July) 26 July Kargil Vijay Diwas 28 July World Nature Conservation Day 28 July World Hepatitis Day 29 July International Tiger Day 30 July International Friendship Day Important Days & Dates of August 2024 August is named after the first Roman empire, Augustus Caesar. Augustus means “the venerable one” or “the great one.” Hence, the term August to honour the great emperor. Important days in August are Hiroshima Day, Independence day in India, World Humanitarian Day, Sadbhavana Diwas, Raksha Bandhan, and many other days in the table below. List of Important Days August 2024 Date Important Days 6 August (First Sunday of August) Friendship Day 1 August National Mountain Climbing Day 1 August Yorkshire Day 4 August U.S. Coast Guard Day 6 August Hiroshima Day 7 August National Handloom Day 8 August Quit India Movement Day 9 August Nagasaki Day 9 August International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples 9 August Nag Panchami 12 August International Youth Day 12 August World Elephant Day 13 August International Lefthanders Day 13 August World Organ Donation Day 14 August Youm-e-Azadi (Pakistan Independence Day) 15 August National Mourning Day (Bangladesh) 15 August Independence Day in India 15 August Day of the Assumption of the Virgin Mary 16 August Parsi New Year 16 August Bennington Battle Day 17 August Indonesian Independence Day 19 August World Photography Day 19 August World Humanitarian Day 19 August Raksha Bandhan 20 August World Mosquito Day 20 August Sadbhavna Diwas 20 August Indian Akshay Urja Day 23 August International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its Abolition 23 August European Day of Remembrance for Victims of Stalinism and Nazism 26 August Women’s Equality Day 26 August Krishna Janmashtami 29 August National Sports Day 31 August Hari Merdeka (Malaysia National Day) Important Days & Dates of September 2024 September is the 9th month of the year. September equinox falls in this month either on 22 or 23 of the month. September 2024 equinox is on the 23 of the month. On this day, both the northern and southern hemispheres have equal amounts of day and night. The important days of September are Teachers' Day (India), Hindi Diwas, International Day of Peace (UN), World Rhino Day, World Heart Day. Let us look at important days and dates of September in the table below. title: Who is Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, the Pro-Khalistan Lawyer in US?
article_content: Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is a pro-Khalistan lawyer in the United States. He is the legal advisor for the SFJ. The Government of India has designated him as a "terrorist". Here's a bit you need to know about the life of Gurpatwant Singh Pannun. By Astha Pasricha Jun 20, 2024, 05:43 EDT Who is Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, the Pro-Khalistan Lawyer in US? On Tuesday, the Czech police showcased the very first video of the suspect in the "murder plot" against Gurpatwant Singh Pannun. The name of the Indian suspect is Nikhil Gupta. Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is the spokesperson and legal advisor for SFJ. Pannun is the Sikh separatist holding dual citizenship of US and Canada. The Sikh is based in New York, and is the secessionist leader advocating the formation of Khalistan. Let's understand the man better. Gurpatwant Singh Pannun Gurpatwant Singh Pannun stands as one of they key leaders of the Khalistan movement. The movement demands for a seperate state to be separated from Punjab, based on religion and name it Khalistan. Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is the legal advisor for Sikhs for Justice (SFJ). The SFJ aims to encourage the notion of a separate Sikh state. In July 2020, Gurpatwant Singh Pannun was declared as a terrorist by the Ministry of Home Affairs. This declaration was made grounds of secessionism and sedition. An Interpol red notice had also been requested for him. The Dual Citizenship Gurpatwant Singh Pannun called himself as the dual citizen of Canada and the United States. Where was Pannun actually born? Well, it was the Khankot village of Amristar, Punjab, India, when Pannun was born and brought up. Why has Pannun been in news? Pannun has been consistently organizing events in various parts of the world like the United States, the United Kingdom, and Canada. Additionally, the man has also been a contributor in filing cases against Indian institutions and officials in the international courts. He alleged these officials of violating human rights against Sikhs. There have been various terror instances in India for which Gurpatwant Singh Pannun has taken responsibility. In the year 2023, Pannun threatened Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi through a video during the PM's visit to Assam. In the same year, there were multiple news outlets saying that the man hid himself post the demise of three prominent Khalistani leaders. So far, there have been multiple videos released by Pannun that censure India. He has also been accused of providing monetary rewards to the ones writing anti-India graffiti. Last year, another video came into light where Pannun warned the Indo-Canadian Hindus to leave Canada. The video was enough to attract huge condemnation from the Canadian officials and politicians For instance, Dominic LeBlanc, the Public Safety Minister of Canada called the video as "offensive and hateful". It has also been reported that Gurpatwant Singh Pannun has made threats against Bhagwant Mann, the incumbent Chief Minister of Punjab. The man also urged the gangsters in the state to join hands with the organization named Sikhs for Justice in order to stop Bhagwant Mann and other politicians from hoisting the national flag in the Republic Day events. Gurpatwant Singh Pannun has been a frequent threat issuer. Designated as a "terrorist" In the year 2020, the Government of India designated Gurpatwant Singh Pannun as a terrorist. Moreover, the man's agricultural land as attached as per the Section 51A of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. There are over 22 criminal cases against Pannun. Three of these cases are based on sedition in India. Access to Abortion Pills Preserved by US Supreme Court: What Was the Case All About? International Yoga Day: Celebrations Underway! title: What is This Fake Google Chrome, and How Does it Trick People? Protect Your Device from this Malware
article_content: Have you recently seen the Fake Google Chrome alerts? You should not be clicking them! Attackers are making use of such techniques to trick users into downloading malware. Here's everything you need to know about the Fake Google Chrome, and how attackers try to trick users. By Astha Pasricha Jun 19, 2024, 20:52 EDT What is This Fake Google Chrome, and How Does it Trick People? Protect Your Device from this Malware The world of the internet and devices is never out of risk. Now, in this world comes another entrant that can swiftly trick many into unknowingly installing malware in their devices. A novel malware distribution campaign is here, that makes use of fake Google Chrome, One Drive, and Word errors as a means to trick people into troubleshooting through PowerShell "fixes" and unknowingly installing malware. Hackers are making use of JavaScript in hacked websites and email attachments. Fake error messages that resemble OneDrive, Microsoft Word, or Google Chrome alerts are now what the hackers make use of to trap the users. Messages like these urge users to tap on a button in order to copy a "fix script" in the clipboard of their devices. Then, users are instructed to paste this copied script in a "Run" dialog or the PowerShell prompt. What makes this attack reliable is the sheer sophistication it demonstrates. Unlike other hacking techniques, users do not get hacked by simply or mistakenly clicking on a button. Here, the users are expected to follow certain steps, in order to "fix" the errors in their devices. The sophisticated multiple steps seem so genuine, that users mistakenly trust the process and fall in the trap. The steps make people believe that they are actually solving a genuine issue, much to their disappointment later on. All these hacks mislead the users to act without analyzing the risks. This has been said by a report by ProofPoint. DarkGate, NetSupport, XMrig, Amadey Loader, Lumma Stealer, Matanbuchus, and a clipboard hijacker are some of the malicious software that ProofPoint identified. The attacking methods There are three distinct attack methods that have been identified. Each of these attacking methods start in a different manner. In the very first method, users go to a compromised website. This method is related to the threat actors responsible for ClearFake. The site opens up a risky script hosted on the blockchain via the contracts of Binance's Smart Chain. The script then scans for vulnerabilities. Next, the user finds a fake Google Chrome alert which says that there exists an issue in displaying the page. The user is then prompted by the alert to install a "root certificate". In order to do this, the user is prompted to copy a PowerShell script to the clipboard of Windows and run it in the Windows PowerShell (Admin) console. Now that the PowerShell script is run, the script scans if the device is fit for the attack or not. It further installs the software that are significantly harmful. The steps it follows are as follows: 1) Clearing up of the DNS cache. 2) Clearing the clipboard. 3) Displaying a fake message to distract. 4) Installs another PowerShell script through a remote server. The script then looks if it is actually running on a VM (virtual machine), prior to installing software to steal the data. This is how the first attack is made. ALSO READ: iOS 18 at WWDC 2024: A bunch of things to know The second attack is called as the "ClickFix" campaign. This attack works by injecting codes into compromised sites. Now, this brings up fake Google Chrome error alerts. Obviously, such alerts overlaying the page are enough to worry any user of errors. In order to fix these errors, the users are guided to kickstart "Windows PowerShell (Admin). Now, they are instructed to paste a certain code. These leads to devices to get infected. The third method is enough to trap possibly anyone. The third method makes use of email attachments. Now, these email attachments look quite similar to Microsoft Word documents. Users are urged to download a "Word Online" extension to view those documents properly. Once the users get stuck in this situation, they are provided with prompts such as "Auto fix" or "How to fix". The option of "Auto-fix" makes use of a protocol that unveils a remote file that is controlled by attackers. This can further install and run harmful files such as VBS or MSI scripts. These further cause malware like DarkGate or Matanbuchus to infect the devices. The option of "How to Fix" urges the user to copy a PowerShell command and paste it into PowerShell. No matter what the method, the aim of the attackers is often filled with malice. Attackers see the lack of knowledge among users as an opportunity to exploit them. title: Intimate Relationships Between Students and Teachers Prohibited: Here's What the New Cambridge Law Says
article_content: Cambridge University prohibits any form of intimate relationship between its staff members and students. What does the new policy say, and what can be happened in case such a relationship has taken place in the past? Here's everything you need to know. By Astha Pasricha Jun 20, 2024, 06:11 EDT Intimate Relationships Between Students and Teachers Prohibited: Here's What the New Cambridge Law Says A new rule has been implemented by the Cambridge University. The rule is not based on any educational reforms, but rather prohibits intimate relations between students and teachers. The aim is to shield student welfare. What exactly is the new law, and what prompted the authorities to bring about such a law? Let's understand. Change in policies and procedures Recently, there have been many reports of instances of many types of intimate relationships between the staff of the Cambridge University and the students. There have been many cases of sexual intercourse and casual flirting reported between students and teachers. As a response, there have been several updates in the website of the Cambridge University lately. These changes have been specifically made in the "policies and procedures" mentioned on the website. As per the new rules, the University prohibits the faculty of the University from pursuing or getting into an intimate relationship with any of the students of the University for whom the faculty has any form of academic responsibilities. While this means that there is no such prohibition for an intimate relationship between teachers and the students that they do not teach, the Cambridge University advises the teachers to not engage in such a setting in order to foster student well-being. The new regulations The new changes in the regulations are as follows: An actual or apparent conflict of interest arises when a personal relation of an intimate nature between a student and a member of staff is formed. Such a relationship may be perceived to forma a risk of abuse of authority or favoritism. The University says that the members of staff are duty bound to act with integrity. A personal relationship of the intimate form between a staff and a student must be avoided at all costs. In case a member of staff has or has an intimate or personal relation with a student they share a professional relationship with, it is the duty of the staff member to disclose it to the Head of Department. A failure to comply with these policies may be deemed as a disciplinary matter. Protecting both parties from unfairness The new policy brought forward by the Cambridge University intends to discourage consensual relationships of intimate or sexual nature between the students and the staff pf the university, specifically in cases where the staff member actually holds a professional responsibility towards the student. The policy makes sure that in case any such relation have occurred, there are certain measures implemented to protect both the parties from any perception of unfairness. This preserves the interests of both the sides. Acting with integrity Staff members of the University are expected to act with integrity. The staff members are expected to refrain from any such situations of perceived or actual conflict. It is recommended to the staff members to avoid creating any personal relations with the students of the manner mentioned above. However, even if such an incident arises, it is the duty of the staff to abide by the disclosure requirements as mentioned in the policy. title: International Yoga Day: Celebrations Underway! Enthusiasts Embrace the Bliss of Yoga in Washington, DC
article_content: Yoga as a traditional Indian practice is no longer limited to only the Indian mainland. With International Yoga Day celebrated every year on June 21, the whole world embraces yoga and acknowledges the yogic life. The celebrations have already begun in various parts of the globe, like in Washington, DC. By Astha Pasricha Jun 20, 2024, 13:14 EDT International Yoga Day: Celebrations Underway! Enthusiasts Embrace the Bliss of Yoga in Washington, DC Yoga is a unison of mind, body, and soul, and International Yoga Day is the unison of all the yoga enthusiasts of the world to celebrate the bliss of the ancient Indian practice. International Yoga Day is celebrated on June 21 every year, but the joy of yoga enthusiasts couldn't wait to explode! The International Yoga Day has been observed by hundreds of yoga followers at an event. What made this event of great significance is the fact that it was addressed by the Deputy Ambassador of India to the US Sripriya Ranganathan. The event took a start on Wednesday in the Indian style, with Indian classical dance performances and prayers. Various enthusiasts took part in the event and underscored the essence of harmony and oneness inspired by yoga. Ranganathan expressed at the event that the ancient Indian practice paves the way for balance and harmony for an illuminating future of the society. She further iterated that the United Nations declared June 21 as the International Day of Yoga, acknowledging the worldwide appeal of yoga. There were several elements that encouraged the introduction of millet into the lifestyle at the event. Additionally, the event also encouraged the use of eco-friendly goods in everyday life. All in all, the event highlighted the importance of a yogic lifestyle. International Yoga Day 2024- Yoga for Self and Society This year's International Yoga Day comes with a different theme. The theme this year is "Yoga for Self and Society". It underscores the relation of yoga and self, and how the ancient practice can be fruitful for society as a whole. ALSO READ: Maryland Governor to Mass Pardon 175,000 Low- Level Marijuana Convictions- Here's Everything to Know The inception of the idea- the history of the International Yoga Day It was Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi who proposed to the United Nations General Assembly, the idea to adopt an International Day of Yoga in September 2014. The purpose was to celebrate the invaluable ancient Indian practice. The Indian Prime Minister expressed at the UN General Assembly speech, the importance of yoga, calling it an embodiment of the unity of body and the mind, restraint, and fulfillment, and thought and action. He underscored the harmony maintained by yoga between man and nature. He accentuated the importance of a holistic approach to health and well-being, at the UN General Assembly speech. The impactful speech of the Indian PM led to the passing of a draft resolution that proposed declaring June 21 as the day for celebrating the yoga practice. After the draft received huge support from a total of 177 member States, it was adopted in 2014. Why June 21 and not just any other day? Here's the significance unveiled Well, yes. The day of June 21 was chosen as the International Day of Yoga as the PM of India, Narendra Modi expressed that the date belongs to the longest day of the year, is celebrated in various cultures, and holds a special relevance in various parts of the globe. The date actually marks the summer solstice. It demonstrates a robust connection between the age-old practice and the rhythms of nature. ALSO READ: Pride Flags Getting Stolen. title: Access to Abortion Pills Preserved by US Supreme Court: What Was the Case All About?
article_content: The Supreme Court in the US has approved the access to abortion pills. However, it has not been an easy and straightforward decision for the court. What was the case all about, and how does the FDA approve any drug? By Astha Pasricha Jun 21, 2024, 02:06 EDT Access to Abortion Pills Preserved by US Supreme Court: What Was the Case All About? It was June 13 when the US Supreme Court rejected a petition by anti-abortion groups that demanded the disapproval of mifepristone, an easily available abortion pill. The approval of the pill has been given by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). According to the court, the petitioners did not hold a direct stake in the matter and therefore the petitioners could not sue the Food and Drug Administration. The ruling was authored by Justice Brett M Kavanaugh. Justice Kavanaugh expressed that the plaintiffs were not the ones who prescribed or used mifepristone. Moreover, the FDA has not asked the plaintiffs to do something or refrain from doing something. Justice Kavanaugh said that to make any drug less available for others as the desire of the plaintiff does not actually establish a stand to sue. What exactly is the verdict of the US Supreme Court in the matter? For now, the court has preserved the access of mifepristone. Two years ago, the Supreme Court of the United States overturned the case of Roe . Wade, which repealed the right to abortion. Take a look at what the present case is all about. The case, the arguments, the contentions It was in the year 2022 when the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) was sued by some individual doctors and four pro-life medical associations. The suit was filed in the US District Court, Northern District of Texas. The petitioners were against the FDA's assent to the mifespristone pills. They also challenged the changes made by the federal agency in the conditions of use of the pill and the provision of providing the pills to remote areas through telemedicine and mail. According to the plaintiff, the mifepristone pills are unsafe. The plaintiffs also argued that the approval process of the FDA was actually flawed. In the month of April last year, it was held by Matthew J Kacsmaryk that the approval of the drug by the FDA should be suspended. It was held that mifepristone should be suspended from the market. The ruling was partially overturned by an appeals court in New Orleans. The court put certain restrictions on the distribution of the pill. The Supreme Court, however, put the ruling of the appeals court on hold. The Supreme Court assented to hear the case. Finally, how does FDA approve drugs? As per the official website of FDA, the FDA goes through a comprehensive process involving many checkpoints and steps. First things first, a drug is developed by a drug maker for the purpose of treating a disease or medical ailment. Tests for the same medicine is done in laboratories. Once these preliminary tests go good, submitting an Investigational New Drug Application to the FDA is what the drug maker does next. The application elaborates the ways the drug maker intends to test and investigate the drugs via clinical trials done on volunteers. The clinical trials are followed based on a set of regulations and laws. These laws are designed to safeguard the rights and ensure welfare of the volunteers. Once the clinical trials are conducted and enough information is gathered in support of the drug, the drug maker can now submit the New Drug Application to get it approved by the agency. Now, the ball is in the court of the FDA. An unbiased FDA team comprising of experts analyze the clinal trial research. They make use of scientific date to assess if the drug meets the rigorous standards of the FDA. If the FDA analyzes that the drug is safe to use, it inspects the facility where it will be manufactured. If the FDA finds the research, date and the evidence in favor of the drug, it approves the drug. However, even after the drug is approved and is out for public to use, the agency continues to monitor the safety, effectiveness, and quality of the drug for years. title: International Day of Yoga 2024: Check How Yoga Day Celebrated in the US?
article_content: Explore how the US joins the global celebration of the International Day of Yoga. Discover yoga events, workshops, and the growing popularity of yoga for well-being. By Nikhil Batra Jun 21, 2024, 08:16 EDT How Yoga Day Celebrated in the US? Every year on June 21st, the world comes together to celebrate the ancient practice of yoga on International Day of Yoga. This year, with the theme "Yoga for All: Cultivating Wellness and Community," the focus is on inclusivity and the wide-ranging benefits yoga offers. But how is this global phenomenon embraced in the United States? Yoga in the US: A Growing Trend Yoga has taken root in American culture, with millions practicing it for its physical and mental well-being benefits. From bustling city studios to serene mountain retreats, yoga has found a home across the country. International Day of Yoga serves as a springboard to explore this practice further. Celebrating Yoga Day in the US The UN is organising a major event for International Yoga Day on June 21, 2024, at 6:00 pm (EDT). The event will be held at the UN Headquarters in New York, specifically in the North Lawn Area. It is being organised by the Permanent Mission of India to the UN in collaboration with the UN Secretariat. Here's a glimpse into how yoga enthusiasts celebrate in the US: Mass Yoga Events: Parks and public squares transform into vibrant yoga studios as communities gather for free yoga sessions. These inclusive events welcome people of all ages and abilities to experience the joy of yoga. Workshops and Talks: Deepen your understanding of yoga through educational workshops delving into its history, philosophy, and various styles. These sessions can help you tailor your practice and explore new aspects of yoga. At-Home Celebrations: For those who prefer a quieter experience, celebrating at home is a great option. Many online yoga classes cater to all levels, allowing you to practice in the comfort of your own space. How to Find Yoga Celebrations? Ready to join the International Day of Yoga celebrations in the US? Here are some resources to help you find events: Local Community Centres: Many community centres offer free or low-cost yoga classes on International Day of Yoga. Social Media: Follow yoga studios and instructors in your area on social media to stay updated on any planned celebrations. International Day of Yoga is a perfect opportunity to experience the transformative power of yoga. Whether you're a seasoned practitioner or a curious beginner, there's a way for everyone to participate. So, this June 21st, join the celebrations, embrace your well-being, and discover the unifying spirit of yoga! Access to Abortion Pills Preserved by US Supreme Court: What Was the Case All About? title: Modi Cabinet Ministers List 2024: मोदी 3.0 में किस सांसद को मिला कौन-सा मंत्रालय, यहां देखें पूरी लिस्ट
article_content: Modi Cabinet Ministers List 2024: नरेंद्र मोदी ने तीसरी बार प्रधानमंत्री पद की शपथ लेकर इतिहास रच दिया है। क्योंकि, पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री पंडित जवाहरलाल नेहरू के बाद वह दूसरे प्रधानमंत्री हैं, जिन्होंने तीसरी बार पीएम पद की शपथ ली है। उनके साथ अन्य 71 मंत्रियों को मंत्रीमंडल में विस्तार मिला है। इन मंत्रियों में भाजपा समेत अन्य पार्टियों के नेता भी शामिल हैं। ऐसे में इस लेख में हम जानेंगे कि किस पार्टी व किस मंत्री को कौन-सा मंत्रालय मिला है। साथ ही किस राज्य से कितने मंत्री बने हैं, यह भी जानेंगे। By Kishan Kumar Jun 13, 2024, 17:14 IST मोदी कैबिनेट 3.0 Modi Cabinet Ministers List 2024: नरेंद्र मोदी ने तीसरी बार प्रधानमंत्री पद की शपथ लेकर इतिहास रच दिया है। क्योंकि, पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री पंडित जवाहरलाल नेहरू के बाद वह दूसरे प्रधानमंत्री हैं, जिन्होंने तीसरी बार पीएम पद की शपथ ली है। उनके साथ अन्य 71 मंत्रियों को मंत्रीमंडल में विस्तार मिला है। इस बार भी भाजपा ने प्रमुख मंत्रालयों को अपने पास रखा है। कुछ पुराने चेहरों को कैबिनेट मंत्री का पद दिया गया है, जबकि कुछ चेहरों को स्वतंत्र प्रभार का पद मिला है। इन मंत्रियों में भाजपा समेत अन्य पार्टियों के नेता भी शामिल हैं। ऐसे में इस लेख में हम जानेंगे कि किस पार्टी व किस सांसद को कौन-सा मंत्रालय मिला है। साथ ही यह भी जानेंगे कि किस राज्य से कितने मंत्री बने हैं। इस बार लोकसभा चुनाव के परिणाम हैरान करने वाले हैं। क्योंकि, सियासी पिच पर कई बड़े-बड़े सूरमा ढेर हुए गए हैं, जबकि कुछ नए चेहरों ने पहली पारी में ही प्रतिद्वंदियों को करारी शिकस्त देकर इतिहास रचा है। भाजपा के खाते में इस बार 240 सीटें आई हैं, जबकि उसके सामने बड़ी विपक्षी पार्टी कांग्रेस के खेमे में 99 सीटों का जनाधार है। वहीं, तेलुगू देशम पार्टी ने 16 और जनता दल(यूनाइटेड) ने 12 सीटें जीते हैं। उधर, राजनीति का गढ़ कहे जाने वाले उत्तर प्रदेश में भाजपा का गहरा झटका लगा है। प्रदेश में यह पहली बार है, जब समाजवादी पार्टी ने 37 सीटों पर अपना खाता खोला है। ऐसे में भाजपा को सिर्फ 33 सीटों पर संतोष करना पड़ा। बीते चुनाव की तरह इस बार भी प्रदेश में बसपा का खाता नहीं खुल सका है। भारत में मंत्रिपरिषद् की त्रिस्तरीय प्रणाली है। ऐसे में कैबिनेट मंत्री, राज्य मंत्री व राज्य मंत्री(स्वतंत्र प्रभार) जैसी तीन श्रेणियों में मंत्रियों को पद की शपथ दिलाई जाती है। इसमें कैबिनेट मंत्री व राज्य मंत्री(स्वतंत्र प्रभार) सीधे प्रधानमंत्री को रिपोर्ट करते हैं, जबकि राज्य मंत्री सीधे कैबिनेट मंत्री को रिपोर्ट करते हैं। 20 साल में पहली बार 24 घंटे में हुआ मंत्रालयों का बंटवारा आपको बता दें कि बीते 20 वर्षों में यह पहली बार हुआ है, जब मंत्रालयों का बंटवारा करने में 24 घंटे का वक्त लग गया है। इस तरह की स्थिति कम ही देखने को मिली है। पीएम मोदी के पास कौन-से मंत्रालय पीएम नरेंद्र मोदी ने अपने पास कार्मिक, लोक शिकायत और पेंशन मंत्रालय, अंतरिक्ष विभाग, परमाणु ऊर्जा विभाग, नीतिगत मुद्दे व अन्य विभाग, जो किसी मंत्री को नहीं सौंपे गए है, वें अपने पास रखे हैं। भाजपा के पास रहेंगे CCS मंत्रालय भाजपा ने अपने पास केंद्रीय मंत्रिमंडल की सुरक्षा संबंधी समिति या सीएसएस को अपने पास रखा है। इसमें रक्षा, गृह, विदेश और वित्त मंत्रालय जैसे महत्त्वपूर्ण मंत्रालय होते हैं। ऐसे में इस बार कुछ प्रमुख मंत्रालयों को पुराने हाथों में सौंपा गया है। इस कड़ी में सीसीएस मंत्रालयों में शामिल गृह मंत्रालय अमित शाह, रक्षा मंत्रालय राजनाथ सिंह, वित्त मंत्रालय निर्मला सीतारमण और विदेशी मंत्रालय एस. जयशंकर को सौंपा गया है। आपको बता दें कि राष्ट्रीय सुरक्षा सलाहकार, रक्षा सचिव और कैबिनेट सचिव भी सीसीएस की बैठकों में शामिल होते हैं। ऐसे में यह समिति भारत की महत्त्वपूर्ण समिति होती है। क्या होता है CCS का काम अब आपके मन में इसकी महत्ता को लेकर और भी सवाल आ रहे होंगे, तो हम आपको बता दें कि रक्षा संबंधी मुद्दों से निपटने के लिए सीसीएस की भूमिका होती है। यह भारत की राष्ट्रीय सुरक्षा से संबंधित मुद्दों से भी निपटती है। वहीं, देश की सुरक्षा को लेकर राजनीतिक मुद्दों पर चर्चा के साथ राष्ट्रीय सुरक्षा तंत्र का मूल्यांकन, परमाणु ऊर्जा से संबंंधित मामलों पर चर्चा और रक्षा उत्पादन और रक्षा अनुसंधान व विकास विभाग में 100 करोड़ से अधिक के पूंजीगत व्यय से जुड़े मामले में यह अपने स्तर पर विचार करती है। ऐसे में इस समिति को कैबिनेट की महत्त्वपूर्ण समिति भी कहा जाता है। किस राज्य से कितने मंत्री(State-Wise Ministers List) राज्य/ केंद्र शासित प्रदेश मंत्री जम्मू कश्मीर 1 पंजाब 2 हरियाणा 3 हिमाचल प्रदेश 1 दिल्ली 1 उत्तराखंड 1 असम 2 अरूणाचल प्रदेश 1 राजस्थान 5 उत्तर प्रदेश 10 बिहार 8 मध्य प्रदेश 5 छत्तीसगढ़ 1 ओडिसा 2 पश्चिम बंगाल 2 झारखंड 2 तेलंगाना 2 आंध्र प्रदेश 3 तमिलनाडू 3 केरल 2 कर्नाटक 4 गोवा 1 गुजरात 4 सहयोगी दल के इन नए चेहरों को मिला मंत्री पद -जीतन राम मांझी- सूक्ष्म, लघु एवं मध्यम उद्यम मंत्री -एच डी कुमारस्वामी- भारी उद्योग एवं स्टील मंत्री -किंजरापु राममोहन नायडू- नागरिक उड्ड्यन मंत्री -राजीव रंजन सिंह उर्फ ललन सिंह- पंचायती राज व मत्सय पालन, पशुपालन और डेयरी मंत्री -रामनाथ ठाकुर- कृषि एवं किसान कल्याण राज्य मंत्री -चिराग पासवान- खाद्य प्रसंस्करण उद्योग मंत्री -जयंत चौधरी- कौशल विकास एवं उद्यमिता मंत्रालय(राज्य मंत्री, स्वतंत्र प्रभार), शिक्षा राज्य मंत्री -डॉ. चंद्रशेखर पेम्मासानी- ग्रामीण विकास एवं संचार राज्य मंत्री किस सांसद के पास कौन-सा मंत्रालय(Party-Wise Ministers List) क्रम संख्या मंत्री का नाम (कैबिनेट-स्तर) पार्टी मंत्रालय 1 राजनाथ सिंह भाजपा रक्षा मंत्रालय 2 अमित शाह भाजपा गृह मंत्रालय 3 नितिन गडकरी भाजपा सड़क परिवहन मंत्रालय 4 जेपी नड्डा भाजपा स्वास्थ्य मंत्रालय व केमिकल फर्टिलाइजर मंत्रालय 5 शिवराज सिंह चौहान भाजपा कृषि और ग्रामीण विकास मंत्रालय 6 निर्मला सीतारमण भाजपा वित्त मंत्रालय 7 सुब्रह्मण्यम जयशंकर भाजपा विदेश मंत्रालय 8 मनोहर लाल खट्टर भाजपा ऊर्जा और शहरी विकास मंत्रालय 9 एच.डी. कुमारस्वामी जेडीएस भारी उद्योग व स्टील मंत्रालय 10 पीयूष गोयल भाजपा वाणिज्य मंत्रालय 11 धर्मेंद्र प्रधान भाजपा शिक्षा मंत्रालय व मानव संसाधन 12 जीतन राम मांझी हिंदुस्तान आवाम मोर्चा एमएसएमई मंत्रालय 13 राजीव रंजन सिंह (ललन सिंह) जेडीयू पंचायती राज और मत्सय एवं पशुपालन मंत्रालय 14 सर्बानंद सोनोवाल भाजपा जहाजरानी मंत्रालय 15 डॉ. वीरेंद्र कुमार भाजपा सामाजिक न्याया एवं आधिकारिता मंत्रालय 16 राम मोहन नायडू किंजरापु टीडीपी नागरिक उड्डयन मंत्रालय 17 प्रह्लाद जोशी भाजपा उपभोक्ता मामले मंत्रालय 18 जुएल ओरांव भाजपा जनजातीय मामलों के मंत्रालय 19 गिरिराज सिंह भाजपा टेक्सटाइल मंत्रालय 20 अश्विनी वैष्णव भाजपा रेल व सूचना मंत्रालय और इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स एवं सूचना प्रोद्योगिकी मंत्रालय 21 ज्योतिरादित्य सिंधिया भाजपा दूर संचार मंत्रालय 22 भूपेन्द्र यादव भाजपा पर्यावरण मंत्रालय 23 गजेन्द्र सिंह शेखावत भाजपा संस्कृति पर्यटन मंत्रालय 24 अन्नपूर्णा देवी भाजपा महिला विकास मंत्रालय 25 किरेन रिजिजू भाजपा संसदीय कार्य व अल्पसंख्यक मंत्रालय 26 हरदीप सिंह पूरी भाजपा पेट्रोलियम मंत्री 27 डॉ. मनसुख मंडाविया भाजपा श्रम व खेल मंत्रालय 28 जी. किशन रेड्डी भाजपा कोयला मंत्रालय 29 चिराग पासवान लोकजनशक्ति पार्टी खाद्य प्रसंस्करण 30 सी.आर. पाटिल भाजपा जल शक्ति मंत्रालय राज्य मंत्री- स्वतंत्र प्रभार 31 राव इंद्रजीत सिंह भाजपा सांख्यिकी एवं कार्यक्रम कार्यन्वयन मंत्रालय, योजना, संस्कृति मंत्रालय 32 डॉ. जितेन्द्र सिंह भाजपा विज्ञान और प्रोद्योगिकी , पृथ्वी विज्ञान, कार्मिक लोक शिकायत और पेंशन मंत्रालय 33 अर्जुन राम मेघवाल भाजपा कानून और न्याय मंत्रालय 34 प्रतापराव जाधव शिव सेना आयुष मंत्रालय 35 जयंत चौधरी आरएलडी शिक्षा मंत्रालय राज्य मंत्री 36 जितिन प्रसाद भाजपा वाणिज्य व उद्योग-इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स एवं सूचना प्रौद्योगिकी 37 श्रीपद यशो नाइक भाजपा ऊर्जा राज्य मंत्रालय 38 पंकज चौधरी भाजपा वित्त राज्य मंत्रालय 39 कृष्णपाल गुर्जर भाजपा सहकारिता मंत्रालय 40 रामदास अठावले भाजपा सामाजिक न्याय एवं अधिकारिता मंत्रालय 41 रामनाथ ठाकुर जेडीयू कृषि एवं किसान कल्याण मंत्रालय 42 नित्यानंद राय भाजपा गृह मंत्रालय 43 अनुप्रिया पटेल अपना दल स्वास्थ्य एवं परिवार कल्याण मंत्रालय व रसायन एवं उर्वरक 44 वी सोमन्ना भाजपा जल शक्ति और रेल मंत्रालय 45 चंद्रशेखर पेम्मासानी टीडीपी ग्रामीण विकास व संचार मंत्रालय 46 प्रो. एसपी सिंह बघेल भाजपा पंचायती राज, मत्सय पालन, पशुपालन और डेयरी मंत्रालय 47 शोभा करंदलाजे भाजपा एमएसएमई 48 कीर्तिवर्धन सिंह भाजपा पर्यावरण, वन और जलवायु परिवर्तन और विदेश मंत्रालय 49 बनवारी लाल वर्मा भाजप उपभोक्ता मामले, खाद्य और सार्वजनिक वितरण मंत्रालय व सामाजिक न्याय व अधिकारिता मंत्रालय 50 शांतनु ठाकुर भाजपा बंदरगाह, जहाजरानी और जलमार्ग मंत्रालय 51 सुरेश गोपी भाजपा पेट्रोलियम एवं प्राकृतिक गैस व पर्यटन मंत्रालय 52 एल मुरुगन भाजपा ससंदीय कार्य व सूचना एवं प्रसारण मंत्रालय 53 अजय टम्टा भाजपा सड़क परिवहन राज्य मंत्रालय 54 बंडी संजय कुमार भाजपा गृह मंत्रालय 55 कमलेश पासवान भाजपा ग्रामीण विकास मंत्रालय 56 भागीरथ चौधरी भाजपा कृषि एवं किसान कल्याण मंत्रालय 57 सतीश चन्द्र दुबे भाजपा कोयला एवं खान मंत्रालय 58 संजय सेठ भाजपा रक्षा मंत्रालय 59 रवनीत सिंह बिट्टू भाजपा रेलवे व खाद्य प्रसंस्करण 60 दुर्गादास उइके भाजपा जनजातीय कार्य मंत्रालय 61 रक्षा खडसे भाजपा युवा मामले और खेल मंत्रालय 62 सुकांता मजूमदार भाजपा शिक्षा एवं उत्तर-पूर्वी क्षेत्र विकास मंत्रालय 63 सावित्री ठाकुर भाजपा महिला एवं बाल विकास 64 तोखन साहू भाजपा आवास एवं शहरी मामलों का मंत्रालय 65 राजभूषण चौधरी विकासशील इंसान पार्टी जल शक्ति मंत्रालय 66 भूपतिराजू श्रीनिवास वर्मा भाजपा भारी उद्योग व स्टील मंत्रालय 67 हर्ष मल्होत्रा भाजपा सड़क परिवहन और राजमार्ग राज्य मंत्रालय 68 नीमूबेन बामनिया भाजपा उपभोक्ता मंत्रालय 69 मुरलीधर मोहोल भाजपा नागरिक उड्डयन मंत्रालय 70 जॉर्ज कुरियन भाजपा अल्पसंख्यक कार्य मंत्रालय एवं मत्सय पालन, पशुपालन और डेयरी मंत्रालय 71 पबित्रा मार्गेरिटा भाजपा विदेश मामले और टेक्सटाइल मंत्रालय यहाँ पर आप सभी बोर्ड के 2024 हाई स्कूल और इंटर रिजल्ट चेक कर सकते है जैसे की यूपी बोर्ड , एमपी बोर्ड , राजस्थान title: Lok Sabha Elections 2024: लोकसभा आम चुनाव से जुड़े कुछ अहम तथ्य, यहां पढ़ें
article_content: Lok Sabha Elections 2024: लोकसभा चुनाव भारत की लोकतांत्रिक भावना का प्रमाण रहा है, जिसमें कांग्रेस पार्टी का आश्चर्यजनक पुनरुत्थान, अभूतपूर्व मतदाता मतदान और राजनीतिक प्रचार पर इंटरनेट का महत्वपूर्ण प्रभाव शामिल है। By Kishan Kumar Jun 11, 2024, 18:30 IST लोकसभा चुनाव 2024 Lok Sabha Elections 2024: लोकसभा चुनाव के नतीजे इस बार आर्श्चयजनक रहे हैं । क्योंकि, भाजपा द्वारा एक और प्रभावशाली प्रदर्शन की व्यापक उम्मीद के विपरीत कांग्रेस ने उल्लेखनीय वापसी की। इस कड़ी में 2019 में अपनी सीटों की संख्या 52 से बढ़ाकर इस बार 99 कर ली। वहीं, उत्तर प्रदेश में सपा ने 37 सीटें जीतकर अपना जनाधार बढ़ाया है। भारत, जिसे प्रायः विश्व का सबसे बड़ा लोकतंत्र कहा जाता है, अभूतपूर्व पैमाने पर चुनाव आयोजित करता है। लाखों मतदाताओं, व्यापक लामबंदी प्रयासों और सोशल मीडिया के प्रभाव के साथ भारतीय चुनाव प्रक्रिया एक उल्लेखनीय उपलब्धि है। यह लेख भारतीय आम चुनाव 2024 से 4 प्रमुख निष्कर्षों पर गहराई से चर्चा करेगा। आम चुनाव 2024 से मुख्य निष्कर्ष -मतदाता आंकड़ें भारत की 1.4 अरब की जनसंख्या में से 968 मिलियन से अधिक मतदाता हैं, जिनमें से 642 मिलियन पंजीकृत मतदाता हैं। ये नागरिक अपने मताधिकार का प्रयोग करके राष्ट्र के लोकतांत्रिक ताने-बाने में योगदान देते हैं। इनमें महिला मतदाता महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाती हैं, जिनकी 312 मिलियन सक्रिय भूमिका चुनावी प्रक्रिया में रही है। मतदाताओं की संख्या सभी G7 देशों - अर्थात् अमेरिका, ब्रिटेन, फ्रांस, जर्मनी, इटली, जापान और कनाडा - के मतदाताओं की कुल संख्या का 1.5 गुना है। यह ध्यान रखना आवश्यक है कि यह तुलना मतदाताओं से संबंधित है, निर्वाचकों से नहीं। इसके अलावा, यह आंकड़ा यूरोपीय संघ के 27 देशों के कुल मतदाताओं की संख्या का 2.5 गुना है। -85+ एवं दिव्यांग मतदाता समावेशिता भारतीय चुनावों की पहचान है। 85 वर्ष और उससे अधिक आयु के मतदाता, साथ ही दिव्यांग मतदाता (PwDs) देश के भविष्य को आकार देने में सक्रिय रूप से भाग लेते हैं। -चुनाव लामबंदी -विश्व का सबसे बड़ा चुनावी अभियान भारत की चुनाव मशीनरी ने एक विशाल अभियान चलाया है। इसमें 1.5 करोड़ से अधिक मतदान एवं सुरक्षाकर्मी शामिल थे। उन्होंने विविध भौगोलिक क्षेत्रों में सुचारू संचालन सुनिश्चित करने के लिए विशेष रेलगाड़ियों, हवाई उड़ानों, वाहनों और निगरानी टीमों का उपयोग किया। -जम्मू और कश्मीर मतदान -दशकों में सर्वाधिक मतदान जम्मू और कश्मीर में हाल ही में हुए चुनाव में कुल मिलाकर 58.58% मतदान हुआ। वहीं, घाटी में 51.05% मतदान हुआ। चुनौतियों के बावजूद नागरिकों ने लोकतंत्र के प्रति अपनी प्रतिबद्धता दर्शाते हुए अपने मताधिकार का प्रयोग किया। -इंटरनेट प्रभाव -100 करोड़ खर्च भारतीय जनता पार्टी इंटरनेट के महत्त्व को स्वीकार करती है और उसने भारत के राजनीतिक क्षेत्र में इतिहास रच दिया है, क्योंकि वह देश की पहली राजनीतिक पार्टी बन गई है, जिसने सर्च इंजन गूगल और उसके वीडियो प्लेटफॉर्म यूट्यूब पर राजनीतिक विज्ञापनों से 100 करोड़ रुपये का आंकड़ा पार कर लिया है। पढ़ेंः Modi Cabinet Portfolio 2024: मोदी कैबिनेट में भाजपा के इन नए चेहरों को मिला है मंत्री पद, यहां देखें पूरी लिस्ट यहाँ पर आप सभी बोर्ड के 2024 हाई स्कूल और इंटर रिजल्ट चेक कर सकते है जैसे की यूपी बोर्ड , एमपी बोर्ड , राजस्थान बोर्ड , छत्तीसगढ़ बोर्ड , उत्तराखंड बोर्ड , झारखण्ड बोर्ड , एचपी बोर्ड , हरियाणा बोर्ड और अन्य राज्य के बोर्ड रिजल्ट देख सकते है। Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha: लोकसभा में विपक्ष के पहले नेता कौन थे? जानें ICC T20 World Cup 2024: T20 वर्ल्ड कप Super-8 शेड्यूल यहां देखें, कौन हुआ रेस से बाहर देखें यहां T20 World Cup 2024 Channel Number List: मोबाइल हो या टीवी कब और किस चैनल पर दिखेगा Super-8 के मैच? title: T20 World Cup Points Table 2024  - Team Standings, Rankings and NRR
article_content: T20 World Cup 2024 Points Table: The T20 World Cup 2024, featuring 20 teams, sees India leading Group 1 after defeating Afghanistan. South Africa tops Group 2, maintaining an unbeaten streak. The tournament marks debuts for the USA, Canada, and Uganda. Top teams from each group will progress to the knockout stages, vying for the championship title. By Mohammad Jazib Jun 22, 2024, 00:02 IST T20 World Cup Points Table 2024 - Team Standings, Rankings and NRR T20 World Cup Points Table 2024: The T20 World Cup 2024 will feature an unprecedented 20 teams contending for supremacy in the shortest game format. This expansion, which includes four more teams than the 2022 edition, marks a significant milestone. The Indian cricket team, striving for its second T20 World Cup title, will undoubtedly draw considerable attention. Notably, the tournament will witness the debut of three nations: the USA, Canada, and Uganda. ALSO READ| T20 World Cup 2024 Broadcast Channel Number List: Star Sports on Tata Sky, Airtel, Dish TV, Videocon, Sun Direct T20 World Cup 2024 Super 8 points table Group 1, 2 The ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 Super 8 round is currently in progress, featuring eight teams split into two groups: Group 1 and Group 2. Group 1 includes India, Bangladesh, Australia, and Afghanistan, while Group 2 comprises South Africa, England, West Indies, and the USA. India leads the Group 1 points table after defeating Afghanistan. T20 World Cup 2024 Super 8 Points Table Group 1 Teams M W L NR PT NRR India 1 1 0 0 2 2.35 Australia 1 1 0 0 2 1.824 Bangladesh 1 0 1 0 0 -1.824 Afghanistan 1 0 1 0 0 -2.35 Group 2 Teams M W L NR PT NRR South Africa 2 2 0 0 4 0.625 England 2 1 1 0 2 0.412 United States of America 1 0 1 0 0 -0.9 West Indies 1 0 1 0 0 -1.343 In Group 2, South Africa holds the top position in the points table, maintaining their winning streak in the T20 World Cup 2024. England, on the other hand, slipped to second place after a loss to the Proteas Latest and Updated - T20 World Cup Points Table 2024 The leading two teams from each group will advance to the Super Eight stage. In this stage, the teams will be split into two groups of four. The top two teams from each of these groups will then progress to the semi-finals. The victors of the semi-finals will compete in the final. title: Happy International Yoga Day 2024: 50+ Quotes, Pictures, Captions to Share on WhatsApp, Facebook, Instagram Status and Stories
article_content: Celebrate International Yoga Day 2024 with us! Explore a collection of images, quotes, wishes, and messages to inspire your yoga journey towards a healthy and fit lifestyle. By Nikhil Batra Jun 21, 2024, 12:17 IST Happy International Yoga Day International Yoga Day, celebrated annually on June 21st, is a global phenomenon that unites people through the ancient practice of yoga. Originating in India over 5,000 years ago, yoga has transcended cultures and borders to become a universal practice that promotes overall well-being. This special day offers an opportunity to embrace the numerous physical, mental, and spiritual benefits of yoga, fostering harmony and peace. On International Yoga Day, individuals from all walks of life come together to participate in yoga sessions, workshops, and events, highlighting the inclusive nature of this practice. Whether you are a seasoned yogi or a beginner, this day is a reminder of the transformative power of yoga in our lives. As we roll out our mats and take a deep breath, we not only honor the tradition of yoga but also commit to a lifestyle that nurtures our body, mind, and spirit. Let us celebrate this day with gratitude and openness, embracing the unity and peace that yoga brings into our lives. So, to celebrate this day, we bring you 50+ quotes, messages and wishes that you can share with your loved ones to motivate them to participate in yoga and indulge in a healthy lifestyle. Post Yoga selfies in Srinagar! Unparalled vibrancy here, at the Dal Lake. pic.twitter.com/G9yxoLUkpX — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) June 21, 2024 योग 'स्व' से 'समष्टि' की यात्रा है, योग 'अहं' से 'वयं' की ओर जाने का मार्ग है। प्रधान सेवक और योगी के रूप में हमारे आदरणीय प्रधानमंत्री श्री @narendramodi जी ने पूरे विश्व को योग की धारा में पिरोया है... pic.twitter.com/NqCvyyOaIn — Yogi Adityanath (@myogiadityanath) June 21, 2024 Indian Army officers perform Yoga, on the occasion of International Day of Yoga. (Pic source - Indian Army) pic.twitter.com/q9Sfoc8UtJ — ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2024 International Yoga Day 2024: Wishes May your yoga practice bring a sense of calmness and tranquilly within. Physical Well-being: Wish for strength, flexibility, and a renewed sense of vitality with every pose. May your mind find focus and clarity through mindful breathing and meditation. Embrace the journey of exploring your inner potential and capabilities. Wish for balance not just in your physical practice, but also in your thoughts and emotions. Cultivate an attitude of gratitude for the gift of yoga and its impact on your life. May you connect with others who share your passion for yoga, fostering a sense of belonging. Wish for the ability to accept yourself fully, with all your strengths and imperfections. Embrace kindness and non-judgment towards yourself and others on the yoga mat and beyond. May your yoga practice nurture a desire for continuous learning and self-improvement. Find the joy in movement, in stillness, and in the simple act of being present on your yoga mat. Wishing you a day of mindfulness and peaceful poses. Happy International Yoga Day! May yoga inspire you to live a life of balance and peace. Happy Yoga Day! Celebrate the unity of body, mind, and spirit through yoga. Happy International Yoga Day! Celebrate the practice of yoga and its countless benefits. Happy International Yoga Day! Wishing you a peaceful mind and a joyful spirit on this Yoga Day. May the practice of yoga bring you clarity and peace. Happy International Yoga Day! Wishing you peace and tranquility on this International Yoga Day. May your yoga practice bring you inner peace and joy. Happy International Yoga Day! Here's to a day of mindfulness and harmony. Happy International Yoga Day! May your body, mind, and soul be in perfect balance. Happy Yoga Day! Sending you positive vibes and peaceful thoughts on this International Yoga Day. Embrace the spirit of yoga and find serenity. Happy International Yoga Day! Wishing you a day full of mindfulness, breath, and inner peace. Happy Yoga Day! May your practice bring you health, happiness, and harmony. Happy International Yoga Day! Here's to achieving balance and tranquility through yoga. Happy International Yoga Day! Celebrate the journey of yoga and the joy it brings to your life. Happy Yoga Day! International Yoga Day 2024: Quotes Yoga is the settling of the mind into silence. When the mind has settled, we are established in our essential nature, which is unbounded Consciousness. Our essential nature is usually overshadowed by the activity of the mind. - Patanjali Yoga is equal parts strength, flexibility, balance, and endurance. - Mandy Ingber My mom was a practicing Hindu, and my dad was a Catholic who practiced yoga meditation and karma yoga. My earliest memories are of the bright colors, beautiful sounds, and fragrant aromas of both Christian and Hindu celebrations. - Tulsi Gabbard Concentration of the mind is in a way common to both Knowledge and Yoga. Yoga aims at union of the individual with the universal, the Reality. This Reality cannot be new. It must exist even now, and it does exist.- Ramana Maharshi Yoga is a way to freedom. By its constant practice, we can free ourselves from fear, anguish and loneliness. - Indra Devi Ayurveda is a sister philosophy to yoga. It is the science of life or longevity and it teaches about the power and the cycles of nature, as well as the elements. - Christy Turlington I mean the whole thing about meditation and yoga is about connecting to the higher part of yourself, and then seeing that every living thing is connected in some way. - Gillian Anderson There are certain ways in which I cultivate awareness, both through mindful yoga and taking care of my body and taking time to actually drop as deeply as possible into stillness, into whatever is unfolding in the present moment. - Jon Kabat-Zinn I love yoga. There's a lot of stretching involved, which helps with my flexibility and injury prevention. Vinyasa is my favorite as a recovery tool and for me to continue having my legs feel good. - Alex Morgan More yoga in the world is what we need. - Diane Lane The goal in some types of yoga is to try and reconcile all the characters within a person, and, in fact, the word 'yoga' comes from the word 'union.' - Asghar Farhadi Yoga is a method for restraining the natural turbulence of thoughts, which otherwise impartially prevent all men, of all lands, from glimpsing their true nature of Spirit. Yoga cannot know a barrier of East and West any more than does the healing and equitable light of the sun. - Paramahansa Yogananda As a longtime practitioner of yoga and a person who's been involved in physical fitness my whole life, I can tell you, yoga helps you achieve altered states of consciousness. It is not just stretching. The only way you can say that it's stretching is if you haven't done it, or that you haven't done it rigorously for a long period of time. - Joe Rogan Yoga is great for easing my back pain. It also helps me keep stress at bay, which is something I can suffer from. - Dervla Kirwan Yoga reduced my stress and bodily tension. It allowed me to bring my body back into balance, to emerge from my fertility struggle with my sense of self-esteem and self-worth intact, and to forge a stronger bond with my husband. - Brenda Strong International Yoga Day 2024: Messages Happy International Yoga Day! May your practice bring you strength, flexibility, and inner peace. I wish you a joyful International Yoga Day! Let's celebrate the power of yoga to unite body, mind, and spirit. One breath, one pose at a time. Happy International Yoga Day! Unroll your mat and find your centre. Celebrate International Yoga Day! Yoga is for everyone. Find your practice and join the global celebration on International Yoga Day! International Yoga Day: Breathe deeply, move mindfully, and embrace a healthier you! Yoga: The gift of flexibility, strength, and inner peace. Happy International Yoga Day! International Yoga Day: Find your balance, reduce stress, and discover the magic of yoga! Inhale the future, exhale the past. Happy International Yoga Day! This International Yoga Day, let's commit to a healthier lifestyle. Yoga is a gift for all ages. Happy International Yoga Day! Happy International Yoga Day 2024! May your practice bring you peace and happiness. Celebrate the harmony of body, mind, and spirit. Happy Yoga Day! Wishing you inner peace and strength on this International Yoga Day. Find balance and serenity through yoga. Happy International Yoga Day 2024! Embrace the calmness within. Happy International Yoga Day! May the practice of yoga bring you clarity and peace. Happy Yoga Day! Celebrate the spirit of yoga and the joy it brings. Happy International Yoga Day! Wishing you a peaceful and mindful International Yoga Day 2024. May your body, mind, and soul be in perfect harmony. Happy Yoga Day!
